intro: Schistocarpha lindenii, commonly known as the Lindens' hardhead, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are typically narrow and hairy. Schistocarpha lindenii produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by hard, woody fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
